chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: The goal of the Xerox Code eXchange Initiative (CodeX) is to transpose and apply the principles of Open Source [XOSP] into our own corporate environment. Establishing internal source code sharing as one of our core software engineering values will improve the quality of our software and the productivity of our development teams while providing a compelling, attractive and rich working environment.

Thanks to the community building effect of software sharing, cooperation and trust should improve in between Xerox research, business groups and customer organizations. If properly utilized, CodeX can significantly improve our Time To Market and create more and better code with less work.

The CodeX initiative is supported by a Xerox internal Web site of the same name that is available at http://codex.xerox.com/. The CodeX web site is provided as a service to all Xerox software development teams who want to share their project source code with others inside Xerox. Since the site went live on January 12th, 2001 the CodeX site has been growing at a fast pace. To us this is a strong indicator that the software community in Xerox is alive and well. It is also asking for more communication and has a strong desire to establish bridges with the rest of Xerox. Further, it shows a desire to speed up the innovation process and to develop more flexible, better quality and more usable software in less time.

Many Xerox software projects have already made CodeX their project home and project teams are now using CodeX services on a daily basis to do their job faster, cheaper and easier. The community is constantly giving us feedback on CodeX and we have responded with enhancements to CodeX that increase its ability to support your projects. One of the requests was to have a CodeX User Guide handy. That is why this document was created. The CodeX User Guide not only describes the CodeX features and services, but it is also packed with tips and guidelines to help you get the most out of CodeX and manage your project with a true source code sharing spirit.

We hope that you enjoy working with CodeX. If so, keep talking about the CodeX initiative to fellow programmers and software management. CodeX users are our best advocates. Also keep in mind that this User Guide is yours and, following source code sharing principles, we welcome your corrections and contributions.
